questions.text: Research is being conducted to find the association between aniline dye exposure and bladder cancer in workers who have worked in the industry for >20 years. Two groups were formed: one directly involved with dye handling and the other group consisting of office clerks not directly exposed to the dye. Years of occupation were noted from records. Then Bladder cancer cases were identified from both the groups in the current time. What type of study is being performed?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Retrospective cohort study

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A retrospective cohort study identifies exposure status based on historical data and examines outcomes in the present, allowing calculation of incidence and relative risk.

questions.text: A 35-year-old homeless man presented with a 1-month history of fever, cough, and weight loss. Both sputum smears turned out to be negative, but the chest x-ray ordered was suggestive of tuberculosis. According to the recent NTEP guidelines, which is the next best line of management?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait until TB culture results to start ATT

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ask for CBNAAT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For patients with clinical symptoms of TB, a suggestive chest x-ray, and negative sputum smears, CBNAAT is the recommended diagnostic tool under the NTEP guidelines, as it quickly detects TB and rifampicin resistance.

questions.text: Identify the disease transmitted by the vector shown in the image:

options.label: B
options.text: Zika virus disease, West nile fever

questions.correct_answer: C. Rift valley fever, Yellow fever
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Rift valley fever, Yellow fever

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Aedes aegypti mosquito, with its characteristic black-and-white striped body, is a known vector for diseases such as dengue, chikungunya, Zika, Yellow fever, and Rift Valley fever.

questions.text: Identify the distribution shown by the Image 3:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Negative skew

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a negatively skewed distribution, the data has a longer tail on the left side, and the relationship among the mean, median, and mode is Mean < Median < Mode.

questions.text: What is not true about the given graph?

options.label: D
options.text: It is usually seen in smaller samples only.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is usually seen in smaller samples only.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) It is usually seen in smaller samples only.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A normal distribution is characterized by its symmetry, where mean, median, and mode coincide, and specific percentages of data fall within standard deviations from the mean. This pattern is more likely to be seen in larger sample sizes.

questions.text: A patient with history of travel to Africa developed jaundice with hemorrhagic fever and conjunctival effusion. He was given treatment but died. Which of the following vaccines could have prevented his death?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 17D vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 17D vaccine is the recommended vaccine for yellow fever, a disease associated with high mortality, especially in endemic regions such as Africa and South America. Travelers to these areas should be vaccinated to prevent infection.

questions.text: Identify the following diagram as given in the Image below:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Component bar diagram

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A component bar diagram (stacked bar chart) displays segmented parts within a whole for each category, useful for showing parts of a whole across multiple groups, as seen in this comparison of students in different subjects over two academic years.

questions.text: Child Pugh Score for Chronic liver disease classified patients into three categories, namely, Category A (5-6), Category B (7-9) and Category C (10-15). This is a type of ____ variable/data now:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ordinal

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ordinal data is used for ranked categories where there is a meaningful order among the groups but not an exact measurable difference between them, as seen in the Child Pugh Score classification for liver disease severity.

questions.text: There is a nuclear family consisting of a married couple and their two children. There is a spacing of 4 years between the births of children. Which phase of the Family Cycle is characterized by the first child moving out of the home of his/her parents?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Contraction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Contraction phase in the family life cycle begins when the first child moves out, signaling a reduction in family size as members gradually leave the household.

questions.text: Under Biomedical waste management guidelines, following could be used for Blood spillage:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sodium hypochlorite

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For blood spillage, sodium hypochlorite is the recommended disinfectant, with 1% used for small spills and 10% for larger spills, due to its effectiveness in eliminating pathogens in biohazardous fluids.
  • ➤ Note :
  • ➤ Note :
  • ➤ COVID-related disinfection (e.g., biomedical waste, bags, trolley): Use 1% sodium hypochlorite or 70% ethyl or isopropyl alcohol. Mercury disposal : Collect using cardboard, place in water, seal, and send to a recycling unit. Color-coded biomedical waste bags : Blue bag : Recycled. Red bag : Used in road making, energy/fuel/oil recovery. White container : Shredded and sent to iron foundries or used in landfill/shopping applications. Yellow bag : Primarily incinerated; liquid waste goes through chemical treatment and then disposed of in drains. Other recyclable waste : Electronic waste (e-waste) . TB sputum disposal : Preferably incineration or dry burning. Placenta disposal at PHC : Use yellow bag, and dispose of via deep burial. Radioactive waste : Store in lead containers and dispose of by sea burial. Temperature settings for waste disposal and sterilization : Incinerator : 1200°C. Autoclave : 121°C with 15 PSI pressure. Hydroclave : Typically done at 132°C. Dry heat : 185°C. Hot air oven : Above 160°C. Organisms for sterilization verification : Autoclave : Geobacillus stearothermophilus. Hydroclave : Bacillus subtilis. Microwave and dry heat : Bacillus atrophaeus. Temperature for cold chain (vaccines in India): +2 to +8°C. Temperature for reverse cold chain (for transporting samples): +2 to +8°C. Milk pasteurization temperatures : Holder method : 63-66°C. Flash method : 72°C.
  • ➤ COVID-related disinfection (e.g., biomedical waste, bags, trolley): Use 1% sodium hypochlorite or 70% ethyl or isopropyl alcohol.

questions.text: Role of Social factors in Disease causation is studied under?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Social pathology

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The role of social factors in disease causation is specifically studied under social pathology , which examines the influence of socio-economic conditions, behaviors, and status on health outcomes.
  • ➤ social pathology
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Culture is acquired and represents socially learned behavior, while acculturation involves cultural contact or mixing of cultures. Internalization is adopting and making someone else's values your own. Opinion is a temporary, easily changeable view, belief is more stable and resistant to change, and attitude represents a more objective, behavior-based view. Customs : Folkways : Less strict customs (e.g., touching the feet of elders). Moors : More strict customs, such as the Parda system, where non-adherence may lead to significant social consequences. Objectives, Targets, and Goals : Objective : Specific, pre-planned activities (e.g., reduce TB incidence by 80% and mortality by 90%). Goal : Ultimate desired outcome, like eliminating TB, an all-or-none phenomenon. Target : Incremental steps with timelines (e.g., year-by-year incidence reduction targets).
  • ➤ Culture is acquired and represents socially learned behavior, while acculturation involves cultural contact or mixing of cultures.
  • ➤ Culture
  • ➤ acculturation
  • ➤ Internalization is adopting and making someone else's values your own.
  • ➤ Internalization
  • ➤ Opinion is a temporary, easily changeable view, belief is more stable and resistant to change, and attitude represents a more objective, behavior-based view.
  • ➤ Opinion
  • ➤ belief
  • ➤ attitude
  • ➤ Customs : Folkways : Less strict customs (e.g., touching the feet of elders). Moors : More strict customs, such as the Parda system, where non-adherence may lead to significant social consequences.
  • ➤ Customs
  • ➤ Folkways : Less strict customs (e.g., touching the feet of elders). Moors : More strict customs, such as the Parda system, where non-adherence may lead to significant social consequences.
  • ➤ Folkways : Less strict customs (e.g., touching the feet of elders).
  • ➤ Folkways
  • ➤ Moors : More strict customs, such as the Parda system, where non-adherence may lead to significant social consequences.
  • ➤ Moors
  • ➤ Objectives, Targets, and Goals : Objective : Specific, pre-planned activities (e.g., reduce TB incidence by 80% and mortality by 90%). Goal : Ultimate desired outcome, like eliminating TB, an all-or-none phenomenon. Target : Incremental steps with timelines (e.g., year-by-year incidence reduction targets).
  • ➤ Objectives, Targets, and Goals
  • ➤ Objective : Specific, pre-planned activities (e.g., reduce TB incidence by 80% and mortality by 90%). Goal : Ultimate desired outcome, like eliminating TB, an all-or-none phenomenon. Target : Incremental steps with timelines (e.g., year-by-year incidence reduction targets).
  • ➤ Objective : Specific, pre-planned activities (e.g., reduce TB incidence by 80% and mortality by 90%).
  • ➤ Objective
  • ➤ Goal : Ultimate desired outcome, like eliminating TB, an all-or-none phenomenon.
  • ➤ Goal

questions.text: Counselling and Screening is done for TB in an HIV positive patient at ICTC Centre (NACP program). This is which level of prevention?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Primary + Secondary

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Counseling and screening for TB in an HIV-positive individual at an ICTC center combine Primary and Secondary levels of prevention by promoting health and detecting disease early in high-risk individuals.
  • ➤ Primary and Secondary levels of prevention
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Prevention Levels for Various Examples :
  • ➤ Prevention Levels for Various Examples
  • ➤ Seat Belts and Helmets : Primary prevention; these protect individuals by reducing injury risk. Source Reduction in Malaria : Primordial prevention, aimed at eliminating malaria risk factors in the environment. Crutches for Polio : Tertiary prevention, used for rehabilitation and disability limitation after disease onset. Resting Limbs in Neutral Position (Polio) : Tertiary prevention, promoting faster blood flow, toxin removal, and slight muscle strength improvement. Mobile Eye Clinic : Secondary prevention, focused on early detection of eye conditions. Integrated Disease Surveillance Program : Secondary prevention, emphasizing early detection of disease patterns without direct prevention. Shakir’s Tape (Malnutrition Detection) : Secondary prevention, used for early malnutrition detection. Multidrug Therapy for Leprosy : Secondary prevention, used for early disease management. Covaxin and Vaccines : Primary prevention, as vaccines aim to prevent disease onset.
  • ➤ Seat Belts and Helmets : Primary prevention; these protect individuals by reducing injury risk.
  • ➤ Seat Belts and Helmets
  • ➤ Source Reduction in Malaria : Primordial prevention, aimed at eliminating malaria risk factors in the environment.
  • ➤ Source Reduction in Malaria
  • ➤ Crutches for Polio : Tertiary prevention, used for rehabilitation and disability limitation after disease onset.
  • ➤ Crutches for Polio
  • ➤ Resting Limbs in Neutral Position (Polio) : Tertiary prevention, promoting faster blood flow, toxin removal, and slight muscle strength improvement.
  • ➤ Resting Limbs in Neutral Position (Polio)
  • ➤ Mobile Eye Clinic : Secondary prevention, focused on early detection of eye conditions.
  • ➤ Mobile Eye Clinic
  • ➤ Integrated Disease Surveillance Program : Secondary prevention, emphasizing early detection of disease patterns without direct prevention.
  • ➤ Integrated Disease Surveillance Program
  • ➤ Shakir’s Tape (Malnutrition Detection) : Secondary prevention, used for early malnutrition detection.
  • ➤ Shakir’s Tape (Malnutrition Detection)
  • ➤ Multidrug Therapy for Leprosy : Secondary prevention, used for early disease management.
  • ➤ Multidrug Therapy for Leprosy
  • ➤ Covaxin and Vaccines : Primary prevention, as vaccines aim to prevent disease onset.
  • ➤ Covaxin and Vaccines
  • ➤ Specific Case - Asherman’s Syndrome (IUD Use) :
  • ➤ Specific Case - Asherman’s Syndrome (IUD Use)
  • ➤ Using an IUD to break adhesions in Asherman’s syndrome functions as secondary prevention (treatment). Leaving the IUD in place afterward transitions to primary prevention, preventing new adhesion formation.
  • ➤ Using an IUD to break adhesions in Asherman’s syndrome functions as secondary prevention (treatment). Leaving the IUD in place afterward transitions to primary prevention, preventing new adhesion formation.

questions.text: A patient presented with Neurological deficit, hematological manifestations and long-standing history of vegetarianism. It is due to deficiency of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cyanocobalamin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin B12 deficiency in long-standing vegetarians can cause both neurological deficits and hematological issues , leading to conditions such as subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord .
  • ➤ neurological deficits and hematological issues
  • ➤ subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord

questions.text: Blood bag should be deposited in which category bag?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Yellow

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blood bags should be disposed of in the yellow category bags to ensure safe handling of potentially infectious biological waste.
  • ➤ Blood bags should be disposed of in the yellow category bags

questions.text: A baby has come to PHC OPD for routine checkup. His growth chart shows Weight of the baby is between 85-95th percentile. He is?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Overweight

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For children, a weight between the 85th and 95th percentiles is classified as overweight according to standard growth chart classifications.
  • ➤ 85th and 95th percentiles
  • ➤ overweight
  • ➤ Remember:
  • ➤ Remember:
  • ➤ BMI Classification for Adults : BMI of 18.5–24.9 is normal, 25–29.9 is overweight (pre-obese), and 30 or above indicates obesity. Below 18.5 is underweight. BMI Formula : BMI is calculated as weight divided by height squared (kg/m²) and is also known as Quetelet's index. Measurement Instruments : Weight: Beam balance (recommended for adults) or Salter scale (for infants). Height: Stadiometer. Skinfold Thickness: Measured by Harpenden calipers at four sites (biceps, triceps, suprailiac, and subscapular). Skinfold Thickness Cutoff for Obesity : Boys: Sum of four sites ≥ 40 mm. Girls: Sum of four sites ≥ 50 mm. Triceps-only measurement cutoff: ≥ 18 mm for boys and ≥ 32 mm for girls. Level of Prevention for Harpenden Calipers : Used in secondary prevention to diagnose obesity by measuring body fat.
  • ➤ BMI Classification for Adults : BMI of 18.5–24.9 is normal, 25–29.9 is overweight (pre-obese), and 30 or above indicates obesity. Below 18.5 is underweight.
  • ➤ BMI Classification for Adults
  • ➤ BMI Formula : BMI is calculated as weight divided by height squared (kg/m²) and is also known as Quetelet's index.
  • ➤ BMI Formula
  • ➤ Measurement Instruments : Weight: Beam balance (recommended for adults) or Salter scale (for infants). Height: Stadiometer. Skinfold Thickness: Measured by Harpenden calipers at four sites (biceps, triceps, suprailiac, and subscapular).
  • ➤ Measurement Instruments
  • ➤ Weight: Beam balance (recommended for adults) or Salter scale (for infants). Height: Stadiometer. Skinfold Thickness: Measured by Harpenden calipers at four sites (biceps, triceps, suprailiac, and subscapular).
  • ➤ Weight: Beam balance (recommended for adults) or Salter scale (for infants).
  • ➤ Height: Stadiometer.
  • ➤ Skinfold Thickness: Measured by Harpenden calipers at four sites (biceps, triceps, suprailiac, and subscapular).
  • ➤ Skinfold Thickness Cutoff for Obesity : Boys: Sum of four sites ≥ 40 mm. Girls: Sum of four sites ≥ 50 mm. Triceps-only measurement cutoff: ≥ 18 mm for boys and ≥ 32 mm for girls.
  • ➤ Skinfold Thickness Cutoff for Obesity
  • ➤ Boys: Sum of four sites ≥ 40 mm. Girls: Sum of four sites ≥ 50 mm. Triceps-only measurement cutoff: ≥ 18 mm for boys and ≥ 32 mm for girls.
  • ➤ Boys: Sum of four sites ≥ 40 mm.
  • ➤ Girls: Sum of four sites ≥ 50 mm.
  • ➤ Triceps-only measurement cutoff: ≥ 18 mm for boys and ≥ 32 mm for girls.
  • ➤ Level of Prevention for Harpenden Calipers : Used in secondary prevention to diagnose obesity by measuring body fat.
  • ➤ Level of Prevention for Harpenden Calipers

questions.text: Measles vaccine given at 9 months age to a boy. Which of the following will not be administered simultaneously?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Hemophilus influenzae B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ At 9 months, Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine is not given as it is typically part of the early infant immunization schedule, not administered simultaneously with the measles vaccine and other vaccines provided at this age.
  • ➤ Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine is not given

questions.text: Recent transmission of malaria can be calculated from:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Infant parasite rate (IPR)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Infant Parasite Rate (IPR) is used to determine recent malaria transmission by detecting malaria parasites in infants under one year of age.
  • ➤ Infant Parasite Rate (IPR)
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Anthropilism is human blood index.

questions.text: Vitamin deficiency in given image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pellagra, due to niacin deficiency, is characterized by the 4 Ds: diarrhea, dermatitis, dementia, and death. A specific dermatitis pattern around the neck, called "Kessel's necklace," is a notable symptom of this deficiency.

questions.text: Under Ayushman Bharat Scheme, how much money can a family get per year as insurance?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 5 Lac

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY scheme provides an annual health insurance cover of 5 lakh rupees per family, focusing on secondary and tertiary healthcare for economically vulnerable families in India.
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ The National Health Protection Scheme was renamed to Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana (PM-JAY) under the Ayushman Bharat initiative. Similarly, the National Iron Plus Initiative is now known as Anemia Mukt Bharat . Programs often continue under new names, reflecting updated goals and approaches.
  • ➤ National Health Protection Scheme
  • ➤ Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
  • ➤ Ayushman Bharat
  • ➤ National Iron Plus Initiative
  • ➤ Anemia Mukt Bharat

questions.text: Man working in a place where they store groundnuts has some poisoning. Most likely it is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Aflatoxicosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aflatoxicosis, associated with Aspergillus contamination, is the most likely poisoning in individuals exposed to stored groundnuts, highlighting the importance of safe storage to prevent fungal contamination.

questions.text: A group organized a Mass gathering on Hand washing awareness. Logical sequence will be?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Awareness – Interest – Evaluation – Adoption

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The process of adopting a new health behavior follows the sequence: Awareness – Interest – Evaluation -Trial – Adoption. Each step helps individuals progress from learning about a new concept to integrating it into their daily lives.

questions.text: In villages, first contact of people to medical health care is?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Subcenter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In rural healthcare systems, the Subcenter is the first and most peripheral healthcare unit, designed to be accessible to the village population and provide basic primary healthcare services.
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Anganwadi Centre Population Coverage:
  • ➤ Anganwadi Centre Population Coverage:
  • ➤ In plains: One Anganwadi centre serves between 400 to 800 people. In hilly areas: One Anganwadi centre serves between 300 to 800 people.
  • ➤ In plains: One Anganwadi centre serves between 400 to 800 people.
  • ➤ In hilly areas: One Anganwadi centre serves between 300 to 800 people.
  • ➤ Doctor-to-population ratio in India: The norm is 1 doctor per 1,000 people. Recent surveys indicate this ratio has been achieved in India.
  • ➤ Doctor-to-population ratio in India:
  • ➤ Nurse-to-population ratio: There should be 3 nurses per 1,000 people or equivalently 3 nurses per doctor.
  • ➤ Nurse-to-population ratio:
  • ➤ Ophthalmologist availability:
  • ➤ Ophthalmologist availability:
  • ➤ One ophthalmologist should ideally be available for 5 CHCs or for 5 lakh people.
  • ➤ One ophthalmologist should ideally be available for 5 CHCs or for 5 lakh people.
  • ➤ Lab technician and pharmacist coverage:
  • ➤ Lab technician and pharmacist coverage:
  • ➤ Each lab technician and pharmacist should be available per 10,000 people.
  • ➤ Each lab technician and pharmacist should be available per 10,000 people.
  • ➤ Health Assistant coverage:
  • ➤ Health Assistant coverage:
  • ➤ In plains: Health assistants are posted at PHCs and serve 30,000 people. In hilly, tribal, or hard-to-reach areas: They cover 20,000 people.
  • ➤ In plains: Health assistants are posted at PHCs and serve 30,000 people.
  • ➤ In hilly, tribal, or hard-to-reach areas: They cover 20,000 people.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes DALY?

options.label: A
options.text: A measure of economic impact of a disease on a population

options.label: B
options.text: A measure of years of healthy life lost due to premature death or disability

options.label: C
options.text: A measure of healthcare costs associated with a particular illness

options.label: D
options.text: A measure of average life expectancy in each population

questions.correct_answer: B. A measure of years of healthy life lost due to premature death or disability
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A measure of years of healthy life lost due to premature death or disability

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DALY is a public health metric used to quantify the burden of disease by measuring years of healthy life lost due to premature death and disability.

questions.text: In triage, what does the red color coding represent?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Immediate attention

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In triage, the red color represents cases that require immediate medical attention due to life-threatening conditions.

questions.text: Trend of Diarrheal diseases can be plotted on:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Line chart

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The trend of a disease over time, such as the occurrence of diarrheal disease, is best visualized using a line chart.

questions.text: Low air velocity is measured by:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Kata thermometer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Kata thermometer is the appropriate instrument for measuring low air velocity.

questions.text: Since many people are dying with Cancer in association with tobacco use, If Government of India made an act to prevent the use of tobacco in community, which level of prevention it would be?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Primary

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary prevention involves specific actions, such as regulations to reduce tobacco use, aimed at reducing the risk of diseases like cancer by addressing established risk factors before the disease manifests.

questions.text: Not a correct match as per the Nutrition Guidelines?

options.label: B
options.text: Additional energy requirement in pregnancy: +350 kcal/day

options.label: C
options.text: Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Vitamin D in pregnancy: 600 IU per day

questions.correct_answer: C. Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ During lactation, the RDA for iodine increases to 280 mcg per day, making option C an incorrect match with the guideline recommendation.

questions.text: A couple goes to hospital and told Doctor that they are prone to have Anencephaly in their baby. Then they asked Doctor how to prevent it. Most likely response by doctor?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Give folic acid antenatally.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For the prevention of neural tube defects such as anencephaly, high-dose folic acid supplementation (4 mg daily) should be started at least three months prior to conception.

questions.text: Match the following with their corresponding descriptions. Match the pairs correctly:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1-C, 2-B, 3-A, 4-D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ "Free days" is associated with menstrual hygiene, "Nikshay" with TB monitoring, "Nikusth" with leprosy case management, and "Nishchay" with pregnancy testing.

questions.text: Patients from different age groups from a village in West Bengal came to clinic with illness. On examination, it is noted that all of them were having edema. On history it was found that they were consuming mustard seed bought from the same local shop. Best probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Epidemic dropsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is caused by argemone oil contamination in mustard oil, leading to systemic edema, cardiovascular issues, and other symptoms.

questions.text: Small for gestational age is?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Small for gestational age typically refers to term or post-term infants who are low birth weight due to growth restrictions, most commonly caused by intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR).

questions.text: Under Colombo Plan, the contribution towards Medical establishments in India was:

options.label: A
options.text: Help with PET scan units for diagnosis of cancer

questions.correct_answer: D. Setting up cobalt therapy units
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Setting up cobalt therapy units

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Under the Colombo Plan, India received support in setting up cobalt therapy units, a key step in advancing cancer treatment in the country.
  • ➤ Additional information :
  • ➤ Additional information
  • ➤ Ford Foundation : Played a major role in public health, particularly in sanitation. One of its notable contributions was the introduction of hand flush latrines in India, improving sanitation and reducing the spread of infectious diseases. Rockefeller Foundation : Known for its contributions in both public health and rural development in India. It introduced borehole latrines, which helped address sanitation needs in rural areas. The foundation also supported the control of hookworm disease, a prevalent parasitic infection that affected rural populations in India. UNICEF’s Role in the Applied Nutrition Program : UNICEF provided critical support for the Applied Nutrition Program, focusing on malnutrition among children and mothers. It provided manure, seeds, and other agricultural inputs to improve local food production, aiming to reduce malnutrition and improve food security at the grassroots level.
  • ➤ Ford Foundation : Played a major role in public health, particularly in sanitation. One of its notable contributions was the introduction of hand flush latrines in India, improving sanitation and reducing the spread of infectious diseases.
  • ➤ Ford Foundation
  • ➤ Rockefeller Foundation : Known for its contributions in both public health and rural development in India. It introduced borehole latrines, which helped address sanitation needs in rural areas. The foundation also supported the control of hookworm disease, a prevalent parasitic infection that affected rural populations in India.
  • ➤ Rockefeller Foundation
  • ➤ UNICEF’s Role in the Applied Nutrition Program : UNICEF provided critical support for the Applied Nutrition Program, focusing on malnutrition among children and mothers. It provided manure, seeds, and other agricultural inputs to improve local food production, aiming to reduce malnutrition and improve food security at the grassroots level.
  • ➤ UNICEF’s Role in the Applied Nutrition Program

questions.text: Target for Reduction of MMR by the year 2030 is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) <70/Lac LB

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Sustainable Development Goal for MMR by 2030 is to reduce it to below 70 per 100,000 live births, aiming to improve maternal health globally.

questions.text: Inactivated vaccine include:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Covaxin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Covaxin is an inactivated vaccine, unlike Covishield, Corbevax, and iNCOVACC, which use other vaccine technologies.

questions.text: The Government of India noticed a concerning trend of incomplete immunization coverage among children, leading to preventable diseases and health risks. In response, they launched a significant initiative to address this issue and ensure the complete immunization of children across the country. Which of the following initiatives was launched by the Government of India to achieve the objective of complete immunization of children?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mission Indradhanush

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mission Indradhanush is India’s comprehensive initiative aimed at achieving full immunization coverage for children and pregnant women by providing vaccines for 12 preventable diseases.

questions.text: In a bustling city with a rapidly growing population, concerns about air pollution have become increasingly prevalent. The local authorities have decided to implement routine monitoring of air quality to understand the extent of the problem and take appropriate measures to safeguard public health. Which of the following is the best indicators for routine monitoring of air pollution?

options.label: A
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

options.label: B
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, lead, and particulate matter

questions.correct_answer: A. Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The best indicators for routine air quality monitoring in urban areas include sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles due to their widespread presence and significant impact on public health.
  • ➤ sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

questions.text: In the given natural history of disease flowchart, the segment from point A to point C is referred to as:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lead time

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lead time is the interval between the earliest possible detection of a disease (due to screening) and the usual clinical diagnosis, representing an advantage in early disease management through timely intervention.
  • ➤ Lead time

questions.text: In a village, it is observed that several farmers have crossed gait and use a stick for support to stand up and walk. Due to poor yield from farms, they consume meals containing rice and pulses only. Supplementing their diet with which of the following vitamins could have prevented this?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vitamin C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin C is crucial for preventing scurvy, a deficiency disease that can cause weakness, joint pain, and difficulty walking, particularly in populations with diets low in fruits and vegetables.

questions.text: Calculate Neonatal mortality rate from the data given below. Total live births were 4000 in the city for the year 2023? Total death among day 0-7: 40 Total death among day 8-28: 40 Total death >than 1 month: 40 Perinatal death: 40
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 20

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The neonatal mortality rate is calculated based on neonatal deaths within the first 28 days of life per 1,000 live births. Here, the answer is 20 per 1,000 live births .
  • ➤ 20 per 1,000 live births

questions.text: A 28-year-old female patient presents with lower abdominal pain, fever and urine difficulty with some vaginal discharge. Which STD kit would be most suitable for the evaluation of this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Kit 6 - YELLOW

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kit 6 (YELLOW) is used for managing Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) under the syndromic approach, based on symptoms of lower abdominal pain, fever, and vaginal discharge.
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:

questions.text: First Referral units in India?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) CHC and Subdistrict hospitals

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ First Referral Units (FRUs) in India include Community Health Centers (CHCs) and Subdistrict hospitals and operate at the secondary level to provide essential emergency and specialized healthcare services.
  • ➤ Community Health Centers (CHCs) and Subdistrict hospitals

questions.text: What is the use of Stepwise approach of WHO in the context of public health interventions?

options.label: A
options.text: Strategies, Tactics, and Evaluation Plan for RTA accidents

options.label: C
options.text: Surveillance, Training, and Emergency Preparedness for Disasters

options.label: D
options.text: Stepwise, Tool-based, and Evidence-informed policy for Measles

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) NCD risk factor surveillance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The WHO Stepwise (STEPS) approach is a systematic framework for monitoring NCD risk factors to help countries collect and analyze data on non-communicable diseases, especially in low- and middle-income settings.
  • ➤ WHO Stepwise (STEPS) approach
  • ➤ monitoring NCD risk factors

questions.text: A 32-year-old Male from Bihar presented to OPD with fever, weight loss and hepatosplenomegaly. He was subsequently diagnosed as a case of Kala Azar. Treatment will include:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Liposomal Amphotericin B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Liposomal Amphotericin B is the treatment of choice for Kala Azar due to its high efficacy and low toxicity.
  • ➤ Liposomal Amphotericin B

questions.text: Match the following vectors with the diseases they transmit. Match the pairs correctly:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1-A, 2-B, 3-C, 4-D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aedes aegypti transmits dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, and Zika . Sandfly transmits Kala azar . Culex transmits Japanese Encephalitis and lymphatic filariasis . Female Anopheles transmits malaria .
  • ➤ Aedes aegypti transmits dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, and Zika .
  • ➤ Aedes aegypti
  • ➤ dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, and Zika
  • ➤ Sandfly transmits Kala azar .
  • ➤ Sandfly
  • ➤ Kala azar
  • ➤ Culex transmits Japanese Encephalitis and lymphatic filariasis .
  • ➤ Culex
  • ➤ Japanese Encephalitis and lymphatic filariasis
  • ➤ Female Anopheles transmits malaria .
  • ➤ Female Anopheles
  • ➤ malaria

questions.text: Correct statement about the Double histogram of Population pyramid shown is:

options.label: A
options.text: Increased height means low life expectancy

options.label: C
options.text: Broad base represents High fertility and high dependency

options.label: D
options.text: Broad base means more working population

questions.correct_answer: C. Broad base represents High fertility and high dependency
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Broad base represents High fertility and high dependency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A broad base in a population pyramid indicates high fertility and a high dependency ratio due to a large young population.

questions.text: In a hospital, the management wants to know that how much time each doctor is spending with patient on an average. They want to increase/ decrease number of doctors, as per requirement, to improve the quality of care. Management technique they should use is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Work sampling

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Work Sampling is the best method for evaluating the average time doctors spend with patients, allowing management to make informed staffing decisions to enhance patient care.
  • ➤ Work Sampling

questions.text: Match the following conditions with their corresponding causes and effects. Choose the correct option: Choose the correct option:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1-d, 2-a, 3-c, 4-b

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is associated with mustard oil contamination with argemone oil . Endemic ascites is linked to pyrrolizidine toxin in adulterated millets . Aflatoxicosis is due to aflatoxin from Aspergillus in stored grains . Lathyrism results from Beta Oxalyl Amino Alanine in Khesari Dal .
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is associated with mustard oil contamination with argemone oil .
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy
  • ➤ mustard oil contamination with argemone oil
  • ➤ Endemic ascites is linked to pyrrolizidine toxin in adulterated millets .
  • ➤ Endemic ascites
  • ➤ pyrrolizidine toxin in adulterated millets
  • ➤ Aflatoxicosis is due to aflatoxin from Aspergillus in stored grains .
  • ➤ Aflatoxicosis
  • ➤ aflatoxin from Aspergillus in stored grains
  • ➤ Lathyrism results from Beta Oxalyl Amino Alanine in Khesari Dal .
  • ➤ Lathyrism
  • ➤ Beta Oxalyl Amino Alanine in Khesari Dal

questions.text: On World Health Day, 4-8 persons are sitting in front of an audience, and they are discussing a health topic. CEO Director of hospital welcomes everyone, opens meeting and introduces speakers. He then introduces topic briefly and invites speakers to present their point of view. This is a type of?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Panel discussion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A Panel discussion involves a group of experts discussing a topic in front of an audience, with interaction among the panelists, as opposed to the lecture-based format of a symposium.
  • ➤ Panel discussion

questions.text: Correct composition about MALA-N is?

options.label: A
options.text: EE 15 mcg, LNG 120 mcg, FF 60 mg

options.label: B
options.text: EE 15 mcg, LNG 150 mcg, FF 30 mg

options.label: C
options.text: EE 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg, FF 60 mg

options.label: D
options.text: EE 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg, FF 30 mg

questions.correct_answer: C. EE 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg, FF 60 mg
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) EE 30 mcg, LNG 150 mcg, FF 60 mg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct composition of MALA-N is Ethinyl Estradiol 30 mcg, Levonorgestrel 150 mcg, and Ferrous Fumarate 60 mg .
  • ➤ Ethinyl Estradiol 30 mcg, Levonorgestrel 150 mcg, and Ferrous Fumarate 60 mg
